reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Contributing to improve the nutrition practices and services for children under five and pregnant/lactating mothers with prioritization of underserved areas

description.narrative:
Based on the recent information from OCHA on the humanitarian situation of people living in hard to reach and besieged areas has been deteriorating in the recent months. Increased malnutrition rates, micronutrient deficiency and inadequate access to basic services are all prevalent factors in Syria. Access to health and nutrition facilities remain a significant challenge for beneficiaries, especially in hard to reach and remote conflict affected locations. In order to address the deteriorating situation of women and children in these areas UNICEF is planning to address the emergency nutrition and needs of the most vulnerable groups in hard to reach and besieged areas such as rural Damascus, Hasaka and Deir Azzour.
The project will target children under the age of five years with nutrition preventative interventions by providing lipid based nutrient supplest and micronutrients to prevent under nutrition and micronutrient deficiencies. UNICEF through this project aims to provide therapeutic services to support the treatment of severe acute malnutrition through outpatient therapeutic centers and health facilities.
For pregnant woman and lactating mothers the project will provide preventative nutrition services such as promotion of optimal maternal and child feeding practices, provision of multiple micronutrients and high energy biscuits.
The project will be implemented through the Ministry of health where there existing health facilities. In addition, the project will be also implemented through national NGO partners that will be identified based on the need. The project will be implemented for a period of twelve moths from the day of approval. Supplies for both prevention of under nutrition and treatment of acute malnutrition will be procured ad provided to the beneficiaries through the partners and through interagency convoys.
The project have a monitoring component through different methods ranging from the use of the electronic data collection, health workers data collection and key health informant in the governorates. In besieged areas where monitoring is difficult other means of communication will be used such as WhatApp, messaging and Skype. Community leaders and key informants will be part of the monitoring and help in the implementation and verification process.

participating-org.narrative: National parters which will be identified.
